column4: how do I mount an apple timecapsule on my network from ubuntu 11.04?
http://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2010/11/connecting-to-your-apple-time-capsule-in-ubuntu/
i saw that article and it doesn't work
there is no command line tool called mount_afp
Try http://forums.macrumors.com/showthread.php?t=636125
I'm just googling ;)
i tried that too "mount error(22): Invalid argument"
bummer hey
yeah, a bit of a pain. Try going onto the network tab of the File Manager and see if you can find it
I'd try: "//192.168.1.50/Data /media/timecapsule smbfs password=<myp> 0 0"
Just don't kill me if that doesn't work
my fstab seems to have UUID=.... hex code.... /storage/diskname ext4    defaults,errors=remount-ro  0   2
Add it on a new line at the end
im not sure what those UUIDs are
do I need one
Those lines  are telling ubuntu where to mount everything currently, just add another line at the end
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fstab
how do I tell mount to run the /etc/fstab without rebooting?
